definition: counterrevolutionary
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
the crime of instigating counterrevolutionary propaganda
pinyin: fan3 ge2 ming4 xuan1 chuan2 shan1 dong4 zui4

definition: counterrevolutionary coup of 12th April 1927, Chiang Kai-shek's coup against the communists in Shanghai
pinyin: si4 yi1 er4 fan3 ge2 ming4 zheng4 bian4

definition: to eliminate counterrevolutionaries/abbr. to 肅反|肃反[su4 fan3]
pinyin: su4 qing1 fan3 ge2 ming4 fen4 zi3

definition: Campaign to Suppress Counterrevolutionaries (PRC political campaign from 1950-1952), abbr. to 鎮反運動|镇反运动[Zhen4 fan3 Yun4 dong4]
pinyin: Zhen4 ya1 Fan3 ge2 ming4 Yun4 dong4

sentences.english: The counter-revolutionary gang was on the rampage for a time, but before long it was completely overthrown.
sentences.chinese: 猖獗一时的反革命匪帮，曾几何时，遭到了彻底覆灭。

sentences.english: In the end the revolution is bound to defeat the counterrevolution.
sentences.chinese: 最后，革命一定会战胜反革命。

sentences.english: The elimination of counter-revolutionaries is a struggle of opposites as between ourselves and the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 肃清反革命分子的问题是敌我矛盾的斗争问题。

sentences.english: Guards were a kind of local counter - revolutionary armed force.
sentences.chinese: 靖卫团是一种反革命的地方武装。

sentences.english: He has created a huge "Central Army" for counter-revolutionary purposes.
sentences.chinese: 为了反革命，他创造了一个庞大的“中央军”。

sentences.english: By doing so, we could ruin Chiang Kai - shek's vicious counter-revolutionary strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这样就可以击破蒋介石反革命的毒辣的战略方针。

sentences.english: The authors also fail to grapple with the anti-progressive impulses of Christian and Jewish fundamentalism.
sentences.chinese: 作者也没能解决基督教和正统派犹太教反革命的冲动。

sentences.english: And we won't arrest anyone, except, of course, counter- revolutionaries.
sentences.chinese: 我们也不捉人，当然反革命的除外。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the official at Window 12 didn’t peg me as a counterrevolutionary.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏12号窗口的职员未将我定性为反革命分子。

sentences.english: The criminal law amendments abolished the crime of " counter-revolutionary" activity.
sentences.chinese: 刑法的修正条款废除了“反革命”活动罪。

sentences.english: The Pacification Guards were a kind of local counter - revolutionary armed force.
sentences.chinese: 靖卫团是一种反革命的地方武装。

sentences.english: The consequences of the counter-revolution have been extremely bloody.
sentences.chinese: 反革命的结果是十分血腥的。

sentences.english: This way the danger of counter-revolution can be reduced to a great extent.
sentences.chinese: 这样出现反革命的危险会最大程度的降低。

sentences.english: The press denounces clandestine support for the counterrevolution.
sentences.chinese: 新闻界痛斥了对反革命的暗中支持。

sentences.english: Basically, these splits are unfavourable to the counter-revolution and favourable to the revolution.
sentences.chinese: 这种情况，基本地说来是不利于反革命，而有利于。

definition: capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
reactionaries/reactionary elements
rebel faction
rightist elements
anti-party
reaction/reactionary
bad element/bad egg
reactionaries
(political) right/right wing/rightist
Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青, Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋, Yao Wenyuan 姚文元, Wang Hongwen 王洪文, who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution
Red Guards (Cultural Revolution, 1966-1976)
Communist Party/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3]
to seize and subject to public criticism (form of persecution during the Cultural Revolution)
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
communist bandit (i.e. PLA soldier (during the civil war) or Chinese communist (Tw))
to eliminate counterrevolutionaries (abbr. for 肅清反革命份子|肃清反革命分子[su4 qing1 fan3 ge2 ming4 fen4 zi3])
